CHAT.comment: Hesitation phenomena have not been accurately transcribed in this data.

the "@f" forms in this manuscript refer to people. Ema@f is Hebrew for Mother, Aba is Hebrew for Father and Bubi is Hebrew for grandmother. In this particular case Bubi is a member of the household also. Davidal@f, Cookie@f and D@f are MOT's names for CHI and Stish@f seems to be either another family member or friend of CHI.
MOT enters the room followed by CHI and finally INV

u.a: MOT puts her bag down on the chair
MOT turns around to look at CHI
INV explains warm-up task to MOT
MOT points to the toys on the floor
CHI squats down and begins playing with the toy car
CHI squats down on the floor and picks up the toy duck
MOT moves her bag and her pocketbook off the chair near the door
CHI squeaks the toy duck in his hand
CHI continues to squeeze the duck
MOT walks around one side then the other side of CHI
MOT sits down on the floor
CHI squats down . CHI reaches out and touches the jack+in+the+box
MOT reaches out and holds the jack+in+the+box
CHI puts his hands down at his sides
<aft> MOT turns the handle of the jack+in+the+box
CHI grabs at the cover of the jack+in+the+box
<bef> MOT smiles, MOT leans back, MOT watches CHI
CHI pulls the clown by the head
CHI pushes the clown inside the box
<aft> MOT pushes on the cover of the box
the clown pops up as MOT and CHI try to close the box
MOT pushes the clown inside of the box
CHI closes the cover of the box
CHI unsuccessfully tries to turn the handle
CHI lets go of the handle
MOT turns the handle with one hand still using the other hand to hold the jack+in+the+box on the floor
CHI touches the handle briefly and then puts his hand on the top of the box
<aft> MOT pulls the jack+in+the+box closer to her
<aft> MOT looks at the jack+in+the+box with her mouth opened wide
MOT motions to the clown with her hand

CHI closes the cover of the box
MOT points at CHI resting her finger in his hand
CHI tries unsuccessfully to close the cover . CHI stands up
CHI squats and pushes the clown inside the box
CHI still has his hand on the clown but he lets it up a bit
<1-8> MOT pushes on CHI's hand in order to keep the clown in the box
CHI tries to close the cover
<aft> CHI leans back from the jack+in+the+box
CHI holds down the clown with one hand and pushes down the cover with the other hand
MOT turns the handle of the jack+in+the+box briefly
<bef> CHI moves the jack+in+the+box close to MOT
<bef> MOT puts her hand on the jack+in+the+box . <aft> MOT picks up a toy football with her other hand
MOT holds up the toy football
MOT looks at the toy football . <2> MOT looks at CHI
<2> MOT drops the football on the floor near CHI
CHI picks up the football and walks across the room . CHI places the ball on a box in the room . CHI picks up the ball
CHI begins to roll the ball
CHI rolls the ball to MOT
CHI looks down but does not see the book . CHI looks around the room
CHI takes a step towards the book . CHI takes a step back
<aft> MOT turns the book on the floor so it faces CHI . MOT points to the cover of the book
CHI walks over to the jack+in+the+box and puts his hand on the handle
CHI squats down and puts his hand on the jack+in+the+box

CHI leans over and watches the jack+in+the+box closely
MOT leans forward so that she is looking directly at CHI's face
CHI grabs the clown and tries to push it back into the box
<3.> MOT holds the clown down in the box
MOT holds the clown down in the box
CHI starts to close the cover of the box
<bef> MOT shuts the cover of the box
CHI puts his hand on the top of the cover
although MOT has her finger on the clown she allows it to pop up for a moment
MOT pushes the clown back inside of the box
MOT turns the jack+in+the+box around so it faces CHI

<aft> MOT leans back and looks at CHI
CHI starts to turn the handle

CHI allows MOT to pull his hand and put it on the handle . MOT and CHI turn the handle together

CHI turns the handle for about a second and then stops
<aft> MOT helps CHI turn the handle

CHI glances at MOT and then focusses his attention on the jack+in+the+box
CHI turns the handle briefly then stops . CHI touches the top of the jack+in+the+box
CHI pulls his hands back and sits up . CHI looks at the jack+in+the+box
<bef> MOT turns the handle for a few seconds
CHI turns the handle briefly and then stops
CHI glances quickly at the toys beside him and then turns back to the jack+in+the+box

< .1-2> MOT leans her head on CHI's hand and looks at the clown . <3> MOT points to the box
MOT pushes the clown back inside of the box and closes the cover
INV enters the room . INV leaves the room while Small Scale Activity takes place and re-enters at 15:41:03
INV explains the Forbidden Object task to MOT and has her sit next to CHI at the table . INV does not remove any of the toys from Small Scale Activity
INV takes out the object and puts it in front of CHI
INV clears some toys off the table

INV sets the object in motion . INV gives CHI the toy beads to hold onto

CHI is still pointing to the object with his finger
MOT points at CHI's hands again
CHI looks at the object . <aft> CHI looks at MOT
CHI is still pointing to the object
MOT leans forward to look into CHI's face then MOT leans back and looks at CHI
INV puts the object back in the drawer
CHI follows the object with his eyes as it is put away . CHI looks at INV
INV tells MOT about Parent Child Interaction Boxes . INV picks up the toys from Small Scale Activity . MOT takes the four boxes off the desk and sits on the floor . CHI watches INV
MOT extends her hand and makes a downward motion with it
<3.> MOT looks at the boxes and reaches over to the boxes
<bef> CHI watches MOT and then focusses his attention on the box

CHI takes the ball out of the box

sharp intake of breath INVressing excitement
